snippet: The two largest utilities in Massachusetts, which had agreed to buy three-fourths of the wind farm’s power, said they were canceling their contracts because Cape Wind had failed to meet a Dec. 31 deadline.
abstract: NStar and National Grid, two biggest utilities in Massachusetts, cancel their contracts with wind farm Cape Wind, saying it had not met Dec 31 deadline to begin construction; company says $2.6 billion offshore project on Nantucket will go forward.
lead_paragraph: The two largest utilities in Massachusetts, which had agreed to buy three-fourths of the wind farm’s power, said they were canceling their contracts because Cape Wind had failed to meet a Dec. 31 deadline.

headline.main: Plan for Offshore Wind Farm in Nantucket Sound Hits a Snag
headline.print_headline: Plan for Offshore Wind Farm Hits a Snag
